name: Glipizide and Metformin Hydrochloride

indications.text: glipizide metformin hydrochloride tablets indicated adjunct diet exercise improve glycemic control adults type 2 diabetes mellitus .

warningsAndPrecautions: glipizide metformin hydrochloride tablets , 5 mg/500 mg pink-colored , biconvex , modified capsule-shaped , film-coated tablet , debossed `` ze66 `` one side plain side supplied follows : ndc : 70518-0908-00 ndc : 70518-0908-01 packaging : 180 1 bottle plastic packaging : 90 1 bottle plastic store 20°c 25° c ( 68°f 77° f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight container . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: glipizide metformin hydrochloride tablets contraindicated patients : severe renal impairment ( egfr 30 mll/min/1.73 2 ) known hypersensitivity glipizide metformin hydrochloride . acute chronic metabolic acidosis , including diabetic ketoacidosis , without coma . diabetic ketoacidosis treated insulin .
indications_original: Glipizide and metformin hydrochloride tablets are indicated as an adjunct to diet and exercise to improve glycemic control in adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Glipizide and Metformin Hydrochloride Tablets, 5 mg/500 mg are pink-colored, biconvex, modified capsule-shaped, film-coated tablet, debossed with "ZE66" on one side and plain on other side and are supplied as follows:
                  
                  NDC: 70518-0908-00
                  NDC: 70518-0908-01
                  PACKAGING: 180 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 90 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25° C (68°F to 77° F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Dispense in a tight container.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original:
Glipizide and metformin hydrochloride tablets are contraindicated in patients with:
                  
                     Severe renal impairment (eGFR below 30 mlL/min/1.73 m
  
   2)
 
  
                     Known hypersensitivity to glipizide or metformin hydrochloride.
                     Acute or chronic metabolic acidosis, including diabetic ketoacidosis, with or without coma. Diabetic ketoacidosis should be treated with insulin.
